definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: But, despite huge upheavals in the world, little has altered.
sentences.chinese: 纵观国际社会乱象纷生，联合国却几乎一成不变。

sentences.english: Her hair is dry and messy like a bunch of straw.
sentences.chinese: 她的头发又干又乱象一束禾秆草。

sentences.english: Minister hits at 'vulgarity' in culture sector.
sentences.chinese: 文化部部长蔡武抨击庸俗文化乱象。

sentences.english: The chaos of China's financial calling the rule of law and constitutional government.
sentences.chinese: 乱象丛生的中国财政呼唤着法治与宪政。

sentences.english: It is easy to cancel the penalty target, but the difficult thing is to overhaul the fine chaos.
sentences.chinese: 取消罚款指标并不难，难的是如何根治罚款乱象。

definition: to oversee/to take charge of/to supervise/to administer/supervisory/supervision
to bring under control/to regulate/to restore to good condition/(coll.) to fix (a person)/to prepare (a meal etc)
to tidy up/to reorganize/to consolidate/to rectify
to strike a severe blow/to crack down/to take strong measures
bad money drives out good money (economics)
pinyin: lie4 bi4 qu1 zhu2 liang2 bi4

definition: norm/standard/specification/regulation/rule/within the rules/to fix rules/to regulate/to specify
to suppress/to crack down on/to prohibit
lit. fish and dragons mixed in together (idiom); fig. crooks mixed in with the honest folk
